CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| electron donating conjugated polymers |
| electron accepting fullerene derivatives |

These are the only two material names mentioned in the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After reviewing the paragraph again, I confirm that the previous table I provided contains the only two material names mentioned in the paragraph. Here it is again for reference:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| electron donating conjugated polymers |
| electron accepting fullerene derivatives |

These are the only two expressions in the paragraph that refer to specific materials.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Up to date |
| bulk heterojunction (BHJ) structure |
| active layer |
| high power conversion efficiency (PCE) |

The "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are:

* "Up to date" refers to the state or condition of being current or recent.
* "bulk heterojunction (BHJ) structure" is a type of device architecture used in solar cells.
* "active layer" refers to the layer in a solar cell that absorbs light and generates charge carriers.
* "high power conversion efficiency (PCE)" is a measure of how efficiently a solar cell can convert sunlight into electricity.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| bulk heterojunction (BHJ) structure |
| active layer |

The "Property Name" entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to "Material property" are:

* "bulk heterojunction (BHJ) structure" is a type of device architecture used in solar cells, which can be considered as a material property.
* "active layer" refers to the layer in a solar cell that absorbs light and generates charge carriers, which is a material property.

The other entities, "Up to date" and "high power conversion efficiency (PCE)" are not material properties, so they have been removed.
